author: ericstj
body:
Remove the following:
https://github.com/dotnet/core-setup/blob/1e298560b0dce474d2b0088350312442e8727190/src/managed/Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyModel/UnifiedJsonReader.Utf8JsonReader.cs#L149-L152

Once https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/34768 is fixed

nodes.author: eerhardt
nodes.body: Triaged. This can't happen until the underlying Utf8JsonReader API is exposed. Moving to future.

title: Remove private reflection from DependencyModel

author: carlossanlop
body:
Area owners: @maryamariyan @eerhardt The APIs in the list below are missing some or all of their documentation. Please add the missing documentation directly in triple slash comments in source. We will make sure it gets ported to dotnet-api-docs after it's merged. Make sure to follow the documentation guidelines defined in the dotnet-api-docs wiki: https://github.com/dotnet/dotnet-api-docs/wiki Also please add me as a PR reviewer. Community contributions are welcome.

title: Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyModel.Tests Fails on Android

author: malylemire1
body:
### Background and motivation

The main problem is that there seems to be no other way of knowing that a MSBuild alias was added to a reference.
This is related to a problem I found using Razor runtime compilation : https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/issues/41632#issue-1232925234

### API Proposal

Add alias informations.


### API Usage

Principally used with AssemblyMetadata GetReference aliases parameter for runtime compilation.


### Alternative Designs

_No response_

### Risks

_No response_

nodes.body: I couldn't figure out the best area label to add to this issue. If you have write-permissions please help me learn by adding exactly one [area label](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/master/docs/area-owners.md).

Issue Details
### Background and motivation The main problem is that there seems to be no other way of knowing that a MSBuild alias was added to a reference. This is related to a problem I found using Razor runtime compilation : https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/issues/41632#issue-1232925234 ### API Proposal Add alias informations. ### API Usage Principally used with AssemblyMetadata GetReference aliases parameter for runtime compilation. ### Alternative Designs _No response_ ### Risks _No response_
Author: malylemire1
Assignees: -
Labels: `api-suggestion`, `area-Host`, `untriaged`
Milestone: -

nodes.author: malylemire1
nodes.body: See also https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/25386#issue-1234105161 for the deps.json in sdk part. It will block adding it to DependencyContext.

Tagging subscribers to this area: @dotnet/area-dependencymodel See info in [area-owners.md](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/area-owners.md) if you want to be subscribed.
Issue Details
### Background and motivation The main problem is that there seems to be no other way of knowing that a MSBuild alias was added to a reference. This is related to a problem I found using Razor runtime compilation : https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/issues/41632#issue-1232925234 ### API Proposal Add alias informations. ### API Usage Principally used with AssemblyMetadata GetReference aliases parameter for runtime compilation. ### Alternative Designs _No response_ ### Risks _No response_
Author: malylemire1
Assignees: -
Labels: `api-suggestion`, `area-DependencyModel`, `untriaged`
Milestone: -

nodes.author: eerhardt
nodes.body:
@malylemire1 - If you'd like to move this scenario along, can you update this issue to follow the examples in [the template](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/new?assignees=&labels=api-suggestion&template=02_api_proposal.yml&title=%5BAPI+Proposal%5D%3A+)? That way we can bring it to API review.

Moving to `Future` as this scenario isn't critical for 7.0.

title: [API Proposal]: Add aliases informations to DependencyContext.
